section.title: Introduction to Alert on Empty Bib Records
section.para: This setting is used to alert staff when the last copy for a record is being deleted. The setting consists of two fields: Context and Value. The Context field refers to either all the branches of a system or a specific branch within a system, with a default of??? The Value field refers to the status of Alert on Empty Bib Records, which can be either True or False, with a default of???

section.title: Changing the status of Alert on Empty Bib Records
section.para: To change the status of Alert on Empty Bib Records, do the following:

listitem.para: On the Local System Administration screen, click the Library Settings Editor link, which opens the Organization Unit Settings screen.
On the Organization Unit Settings screen, click the Context Location arrow to see more options. In the Context Location box, select a location.
On the Organization Unit Settings screen, click the Edit button beside the Alert on Empty Bib Records setting.
In the Edit Setting pop-up window, click the Context arrow for more options. In the Context box, select a location.
In the Edit Setting pop-up window, click the Value arrow for more options. In the Value box, select a status.
To view the new data for Context and Value, in the Edit Setting pop-up window, click the Update Setting button.
On the Organization Unit Settings screen, on the Alert on Empty Bib Records row, you see the current selected location under the Context column and the current selected status under the Value column.
To delete the data for both Context and Value on the Alert on Empty Bib Records row, click the Delete Setting button.

example.title: Example of Alert on Empty Bib Records
example.para: To change Value to False, in the Value box, select False.
To view the change, click the Update Setting button.

Introduction to Allow Credit Card Payments
section.para: If enabled, patrons will be able to pay fines accrued at this location via credit card. The default value is True??? It can be changed through the Local System Administration menu.

section.title: Allow Credit Card Payments
section.para: To allow credit card payments, do the following:

listitem.para: On the Local System Administration screen, click the Library Settings Editor link.
On the Organization Unit Settings screen, click the Edit button beside the Allow Credit Card Payments setting.
In the Edit Setting pop-up window, select a location from the Context box.
In the Value box, select a value.

example.title: Example of Allow Credit Card Payments
example.para: To change the credit card payment status to false, select False from the Value list.

section.title: Change Reshelving Status Interval
section.para: To change the reshelving status interval, do the following:

listitem.para: On the Local System Administration screen, click the Library Settings Editor link.
On the Organization Unit Settings screen, find the setting Change reshelving status interval, and click Edit.
In the Edit Setting pop-up window, select a location from the Context box.
In the Value box, enter a value in seconds, hours, or days. The value cannot be zero; however, a value of 1 second is valid.
Click the Update Setting button.
On the Organization Unit Settings screen, you can see the selected organization unit under the Context column and the reshelving status interval under the Value column.
To delete both Context and Value for the reshelving status interval, click on Delete Setting.

example.title: Example of Change Reshelving Status Interval
example.para: For example, to change the reshelving status interval to four hours, enter 4 hours in the Value box.

section.title: References for Change Reshelving Status Interval
Notes for Change Reshelving Status Interval

note.para: The reshelving status interval is not inherited from the parent organizational unit at run time. The default value is 24 hours??? and can be changed through the Local System Administration menu.
Permissions for organization unit settings are not automatically created at install time, which means the permission will have to be created before it can be applied.
